page.lettertext:
fol.170r
Belgia 1590 May
Belg
ia
159
0
30 M
ay
To my
L.
Buckh
urs
t
Right honorable & my very good L. I [am] don to witt, that her
Ma
tie
hath entreated yo
u
to make a voyage into these contreys for the care of those
maladies that disease this goverment. It may happely be
t
[her] Ma
ties
disposition is very much against yt for the affaires are very tedious & full
of intricat troubles. Nev
r
theles I can assure yo
r
self upon knowledge
there ys such a g
na
l longing for yo
r
coming & such meanes wilbe
offred of spetiall assistaunce, as yt cannot but affect sum
singular good./ Yf yo
r
first appointment had held about 12 monethes
since yt was easyer about
t
time then yt is at this present, to
order ev
r
y thing well & to her Ma
ties
liking, but now ambitious
humo
rs
have had so much leysure to
suad, & to practise what they
list to serve their secret & prviate desseins, as I dout hereafter
they will not think yt for their credits to
[.]
alter theyr
courses. I would yt were not so apparant as I do expresse
yt, but for mine owne
te I stand assured, & yt is a comfort
unto me that yo
r
L. shall
ceave yt that matters have bin
caried worse yn these countreyes then by waie of writing from
mee could conveniently be signified. Howbeyt I referr
e
consyderation of all these causes to yo
r
coming to this place
intending onely by this letter to beseech yo
u
very humbly to command
my service, yf in any thing before yo
r
arrivall or wheresoev
r
oth
r
wise
yo
u
shall have cause to use me
& thens I take my humble leave
Hage
